Sentencas: Developments of highly efficient catalysts for hydrocarbon fuel conversion have a critical importance for the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) technology and hydrogen production.
Titulo: Methane partial oxidation over porous nickel monoliths: The effects of NiO-MgO loading on microstructural parameters and hot-spot temperature

Sentencas: In this work, a series of catalytic monoliths made of porous Ni ribbons with various NiO-MgO loadings were prepared via impregnation with the metal acetates and calcination.
Titulo: Methane partial oxidation over porous nickel monoliths: The effects of NiO-MgO loading on microstructural parameters and hot-spot temperature

Sentencas: The catalysts were tested for the partial oxidation of methane under adiabatic conditions without inlet flow preheating at air excess factors, O-2/(2 center dot CH4), varying in the range 0.3-0.4.
Titulo: Methane partial oxidation over porous nickel monoliths: The effects of NiO-MgO loading on microstructural parameters and hot-spot temperature

Sentencas: When NiO-MgO loading increases, the inlet hot spot temperature was found to exhibit minima reflecting changes of the CH4 reforming rate-determining factors in the catalyst frontal layer.
Titulo: Methane partial oxidation over porous nickel monoliths: The effects of NiO-MgO loading on microstructural parameters and hot-spot temperature

Sentencas: A model describing this unusual phenomenon in terms of the volumetric activity and gas permeability of the porous catalysts, was proposed.
Titulo: Methane partial oxidation over porous nickel monoliths: The effects of NiO-MgO loading on microstructural parameters and hot-spot temperature

Sentencas: The model was validated using experimental results of the catalytic tests, high-resolution transmission electron microscopy and mercury porosimetry.
Titulo: Methane partial oxidation over porous nickel monoliths: The effects of NiO-MgO loading on microstructural parameters and hot-spot temperature
